metadata.title: CVE-2024-36019 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: regmap:maple: Fix cache corruption in regcache_maple_drop() When keeping the upperend of a cache block entry, the entry[] array must be indexed by the offsetfrom the base register of the block, i.e. max - mas.index. The code wasindexing entry[] by only the register address, leading to an out-of-boundsaccess that copied some part of the kernel memory over the cache contents.This bug was not detected by the regmap KUnit test because it only testswith a block of registers starting at 0, so mas.index == 0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36019` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
